weka.description: The base command for all weka related CLIs

options.--build: Prints the CLI build number and exits
options.-v, --version: Prints the CLI version and exits
options.--legal: Prints software license information and exits

agent.description: Commands that control the weka agent (outside the weka containers)

install-agent.description: Installs Weka agent on the machine the command is executed from

options.--no-update: Don't update the locally installed containers

update-containers.description: Update the currently available containers and version specs to the current agent version. This

supported-specs.description: List the Weka spec versions that are supported by this agent version

uninstall.description: Deletes all Weka files, drivers, shared memory and any other remainder from the machine this

options.--force: Force the action to actually happen
options.--ignore-wekafs-mounts: Proceed even with active wekafs mounts
options.--keep-files: Do not remove Weka version images and keep in installation directory

alerts.description: List alerts in the Weka cluster

options.-H, --HOST: Specify the host. Alternatively, use the WEKA_HOST env variable
options.-P, --PORT: Specify the port. Alternatively, use the WEKA_PORT env variable
options.-C, --CONNECT-TIMEOUT: Timeout for connecting to cluster, default: 10 secs (format: 3s, 2h, 4m, 1d, 1d5h, 1w, infinite/unlimited)
options.-T, --TIMEOUT: Timeout to wait for response, default: 1 minute (format: 3s, 2h, 4m, 1d, 1d5h, 1w, infinite/unlimited)
options.--profile: Name of the connection and authentication profile to use
options.-f, --format: Specify in what format to output the result. Available options are: view|csv|markdown|json|oldview (format: 'view', 'csv', 'markdown', 'json' or 'oldview')
options.-o, --output: Specify which columns to output. May include any of the following: muted,type,count,title,description,action
options.-s, --sort: Specify which column(s) to take into account when sorting the output. May include a '+' or '-' before the column name to sort in ascending or descending order respectively. Usage: [+|-]column1[,[+|-]column2[,..]]
options.-F, --filter: Specify what values to filter by in a specific column. Usage: column1=val1[,column2=val2[,..]]
options.--muted: List muted alerts alongside the unmuted ones
options.--no-header: Don't show column headers when printing the output

options.-H, --HOST: Specify the host. Alternatively, use the WEKA_HOST env variable

options.--category: Retrieve only statistics of the specified categories
options.--process-ids: Limit the report to the specified processes
options.--param: For parameterized statistics, retrieve only the instantiations where the specified parameter is of the specified value. Multiple values can be supplied for the same key, e.g. '--param method:putBlocks --param method:initBlock'. (format: key:value)
options.-o, --output: Specify which columns to output. May include any of the following: node,category,timestamp,stat,unit,value,containerId,container,hostname,roles
options.-s, --sort: Specify which column(s) to take into account when sorting the output. May include a '+' or '-' before the column name to sort in ascending or descending order respectively. Usage: [+|-]column1[,[+|-]column2[,..]]
options.-F, --filter: Specify what values to filter by in a specific column. Usage: column1=val1[,column2=val2[,..]]
options.--accumulated: Show accumulated statistics, not rate statistics
options.--per-process: Do not aggregate statistics across processes
options.-Z, --no-zeros: Do not retrieve results where the value is 0
options.-R, --raw-units: Print values in raw units (bytes, seconds, etc.). When not set, sizes are printed in human-readable format, e.g 1KiB 234MiB 2GiB.
options.-U, --UTC: Print times in UTC. When not set, times are converted to the local time of this host.
options.--no-header: Don't show column headers when printing the output

writable.description: Debug commands for controlling drive writability

off.description: Command used to set disks as unwritable

on.description: Command used to set disks as writable

pdsh.description: Run a bash command on all hosts using ssh

options.-i, --identity-file: Selects a file from which the identity (private key) for public key authentication is read.
options.-f, --fanout: The number of hosts to run in parallel (defaults to 32) (format: 1..1024)
options.-C, --container: The container to get config from
options.--config: Config json file to use instead of dumping
options.--hosts: A list of host ids to run command on
options.--exclude-hosts: A list of host ids to explicitly not run command on
options.--ssh-opts: Options to pass to the underlying ssh commands
options.-S, --forward-status: Return the largest of the remote command return values
options.--drives: Run command on all servers with drive containers
options.--computes: Run command on all servers with compute containers
options.--frontends: Run command on all servers with frontend containers
options.--dry-run: Only print the commands without running them
options.--print-hosts: Only print the selected hosts. Can be used as an input file for pdsh. e.g.: `weka debug pdsh --computes --print-hosts > hosts.txt`, `pdsh -w ^hosts.txt echo hello`
options.--by-ips: Connect to hosts using ips instead of hostname
options.-o, --format-output: Formats the output of the commands more cleanly

options.-C, --container: The container to get revision from

flock.description: Commands used to debug the flocks

list.description: List all active locks on the backend taken for the file

options.-H, --HOST: Specify the host. Alternatively, use the WEKA_HOST env variable
options.-P, --PORT: Specify the port. Alternatively, use the WEKA_PORT env variable
options.-C, --CONNECT-TIMEOUT: Timeout for connecting to cluster, default: 10 secs (format: 3s, 2h, 4m, 1d, 1d5h, 1w, infinite/unlimited)
options.-T, --TIMEOUT: Timeout to wait for response, default: 1 minute (format: 3s, 2h, 4m, 1d, 1d5h, 1w, infinite/unlimited)
options.--profile: Name of the connection and authentication profile to use
options.-f, --format: Specify in what format to output the result. Available options are: view|csv|markdown|json|oldview (format: 'view', 'csv', 'markdown', 'json' or 'oldview')
options.-o, --output: Specify which columns to output. May include any of the following: nodeId,start,end,type,owner
options.-s, --sort: Specify which column(s) to take into account when sorting the output. May include a '+' or '-' before the column name to sort in ascending or descending order respectively. Usage: [+|-]column1[,[+|-]column2[,..]]
options.-F, --filter: Specify what values to filter by in a specific column. Usage: column1=val1[,column2=val2[,..]]
options.--no-header: Don't show column headers when printing the output
